text: I know it's not ideal, but you could try changing the delimiters for Vue? Ala <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33628558/vue-js-change-tags>
That’s actually a good idea, I hadn’t thought about that. Yeah it’s not ideal, but it’s just a matter of making it work. And rather this, than iframing the code in :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U7W3EP1A6> 
there’s also {%raw%} Put your vue code here{%endraw%}

If you do this you don’t need to change delimiters.
Nice, didn't know that. Thanks!
I use raw on the daily lol
just curious - Mark do you regularly use Vue/React or something on HubSpot?
I use Vue with HubSpot, and React for side projects, as well as working on a headless JAMstack setup for non-HS clients.

<@U26BLKGE4> What do you tend to use Vue for on your HS projects, just wondering, maybe it’d give some new ideas for solving problems. we don’t typically have too many complicated single page app like interfaces, the craziest we tend to get is some crazy levels of filtering on blog posts and hubDBs on the client side

Mainly interactive elements. Things like multi-step quizes, I've done a couple cool components for like featured projects where they'll behave based on hover on desktop and tap on mobile, sliders with live feedback, I have an internal project I'm pretty excited about but keeps getting put on the backburner which is an interactive ebook module/template.

One of my big initiatives for this year also is relying less on "traditional points of conversion," ie CTAs and forms in favor of more natural and implicit feedback methods like interactive tools that asynchronously send feedback to HS without needing an extra page request, but this is all pretty conceptual still and I haven't had too much time to dedicate to it yet.

very cool, the ebook thing sounds awesome.

I’ve done some multi-step quizzes too but the way we had to do them for the client wasn’t as sophisticated. Would be a lot easier to do them now using HubDB and the new custom modules though.

The new module system is what made me invest more in Vue's usage because of the repeaters especially; super powerful. I use them to populate a data variable that is then cycled through when Vue renders. Hopefully I get motivated enough soon and actually write a blog post about it lol.
<@U26BLKGE4> Let us know when you do Id love to read it.
Will do! Is there anything specific people would like to learn how to build? Want to make sure it would be as useful as possible.
I am starting to become more interested in vue as we do a lot of Interactive style assessments and calculators.

Hey y’all, trying out the new design manager and making a custom module. I remember seeing the ability to have .css file be a part of the custom module. And in the design manager, the top half shows the html, and the bottom half shows the .css. How do I actually do that? All I see is the ability to link a css file.
<@U7AU6414J> are you referring to this area:
<@U2H3TT8F2> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H3TT8F2/F99UDGV9S/image.png|image.png>

think <@U7AU6414J> is actually meaning the css section in the middle.

See under the HTML+HUBL section theres a section that says CSS, right above JS

You can try ~using {{ require_css("<http://example.com/path/to/file.css>") }}~ (<@U7V9DQ31P> was right, this doesnt work) perhaps creating a empty CSS file, using an `@import`, and pulling the css in that way. Then simply link the css file with imports.
the bottom of this page should tell you tags/functions you can't use in the the custom modules: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/reference>
this isn't recommended in the new custom modules
you are correct, looks like this doesnt work either

clarification on the require_css bit - you can’t use get_public_template_URL() the require_css bit still works. I too was confused by the documentation regarding this. Think Jeff or Shawn Bristow clarified it in the design manager channel previously.

Bascially require_css and require_js can only be used for off HubSpot files. for example if you’re using a CDN’d file. Otherwise for all HS hosted files use the linked files feature.

This means yes, you can’t conditionally load a HS based file but you can still do it with external files.
